page.title: 05CLUNBURY CHURCH
page.content: { Saint Swithin's}church is the only one in the nearby area. It is an Anglican church. The chapels have all closed down but the{Church of England is still popular. It is used by the school for{harvest festivals}and end of term services when the children lead the sevice and play the music. Clunbury no longer has its own priest but shares one with three other parishes. There is a rota in the church for people to clean and put flowers in, and there is a{Parochial Church {Council.}Clunbury Church has some {Norman}parts and the rest added later, with all the windows different shapes. It has not been changed for several hundred years.
